body.name: Mystery at the Abbey Hotel: An utterly addictive cozy mystery novel (An Eve Mallow Mystery Book 5)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Mystery was Very well written and was hard to put down. Too many nights staying up to late. On to the book 6.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Once again Eve finds herself in the thick of things , another mystery that needs her special touch. Recommend it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very Engaging. Another Eve Mellow Winner!
reviews.reviewText: Eve hasn't disappointed her fans in this installment. I loved the initial setting of the crime. The Abbey just sounded so sumptuous and I was imagining what a great to have in my hometown. Eve certainly doesn't need to go far for murder to land in her lap. The plots and characters are so well thought out and defined that nothing about the story felt contrived. I really enjoyed this book as much as the previous books. Sometimes Authors of long series begin to have their characters wear thin or become just tired. Not in this case. The writing is still fresh and thoughtful. Now I'm going to go brew up spot of Yorkshire tea and have an English muffin with some lovely marmalade and settle down on the couch with my Dachshund "Albert" as we start the next book. What a treat. I highly recommend this series if you love a wholesome, escape to the British countryside with an Obituary writing, part time baker and murder investigator! What a great and interesting basis for a protagonist. You won't be disappointed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love the character of eve
reviews.reviewText: Couldn’t put it down, total surprise at the guilty one. Love the interaction between eve and her neighbors and I especially love how she bounces her thoughts with her dog Gus!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Having finished this book, I find relief in being done. In my opinion, there were too many characters, making it difficult to follow. I had a problem keeping everyone straight. The plot was interesting but I found too many red herrings to try to untangle. One of my problems, when reading any book, is deciding when to give up and stop if I am frustrated. The final plot twist was worth the effort but I will find it difficult to choose another book by this author.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It was really a great mystery, but it was too long for the investigation. I feel that Eve, is an exciting investigator.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Hitting her stride
reviews.reviewText: This is Book 5. I stayed up 2 nights in a row til 3 am to finish; I’m a slow reader. Another excellent cozy mystery with Eve Mallow. I love being in her head and following her logic. Clare Chase does talk a lot about pastries and other sweets. Perhaps she can add some recipes at end so readers can imagine better what these sweets may taste like.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best so far
reviews.reviewText: Yes, I do think this is the best book in the series so far. The setting is lovely and the author brings it to life for the reader. The characters are real and the mystery keeps one guessing. All in all a very good read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Hugely enjoyable and most accomplished novel in the series so far
reviews.reviewText: In this hugely enjoyable outing for obituary writer turned sleuth, Eve Mallow, she’s won a stay at the classy Abbey Hotel. She immediately takes to the owner, Debra Moran, who has a very clear vision for the future. Unfortunately, someone kills her in the woods that night, bringing the police to the hotel to investigate.As Eve collects details for an obituary and her own investigation, a second murder shocks the peaceful Suffolk countryside.With a large number of suspects and motives, it’s slow progress. Gardener and former police officer Robin is on hand to pass information both ways as the investigation deepens, bringing Eve closer and closer to the killer, who may have little choice but to silence her.With such a wide choice of suspects, the mystery takes some sorting out, and remains intriguing until Eve finally slots the pieces together for a tense, nail biting climax.Like the previous novels in the series, Eve and dachshund Gus are a formidable pair. Fellow villagers follow her progress with interest, often chipping in with useful details and gossip. The characters and relationships bring a warm glow this cosy mystery, adding humour and interest at every stage.While the book works fine as a standalone, it’s more fun and much more interesting to follow Eve and her fellow villagers through the series, getting to know them like old friends. The series gets better and better and this story is the most accomplished and satisfying to date.Looking forward to the next in the series.
Twists and turns made it impossible to put down. Just when I felt I knew who the culprit was, things would change again. Thoroughly enjoyed it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The storyline was interesting and similar to the other stories. I did however get bored and slightly confused with the characters in parts of the book and I had to return to the point so I could re-read
I enjoyed reading this book, with all its twists and turns. I like a story that has mystery and intrigue but does not need to use graphic violence to achieve a satisfactory result.
